questions.question: Which symbol is used to specify default values for parameters?
Can a Kotlin function have multiple return statements?
What is the syntax to define a single-expression function?
How do you specify the return type of a function?
What is an inline function?
options: A function defined within a class.
A function that avoids object allocation by inlining calls.
questions.correctAnswer: A function that avoids object allocation by inlining calls.

questions.question: What is a lambda function in Kotlin?
options: A function with a return value.

questions.question: How does one make a class that is not an abstract class extendable in Kotlin?
options: No extra keywords are needed: they are extendable by default.
The open keyword simply needs to be placed before the class keyword to make a class extendable.
The open keyword needs to be applied both to the class itself and to the methods and properties that one wants to make extendable and overrideable.
questions.correctAnswer: The open keyword needs to be applied both to the class itself and to the methods and properties that one wants to make extendable and overrideable.

questions.question: We have a superclass Person: open class Person(open val name : String, open val age : Int).  How do we extend it?
options: class Student(override val name : String, override val age : Int) : Person(name, age)
class Student(override val name : String, override val age : Int) : Person
class Student(val name : String, val age : Int) : Person(name, age)
questions.correctAnswer: class Student(override val name : String, override val age : Int) : Person(name, age)

questions.question: Which of the following are issues with inheritance?
options: Modifying a single superclass will require changes to the subclasses that inherit from it.
One needs to manage not only the constructor of the subclasses but also the constructor of the parent class
Multiple superclasses that have different implementations of properties and methods can conflict with eachother if one subclass inherits from multiple.

questions.question: True of False: objects can inherit from classes.
What are the benefits of composition?
options: Greater modularity as each component of a class can be managed individually.
questions.correctAnswer: Greater modularity as each component of a class can be managed individually.

questions.question: Which of the following is a downside to composition?
options: As one creates more complex classes, it may become more difficult to test complex classes.
The initialization of an extremely complex class will require the initialization of its parts.

questions.question: With regards to inheritance and composition, what do many industry experts recommend?
options: Abandon all hope with inheritance and switch to composition completely.
Use inheritance sparingly and only when it would be more efficient to use than composition but avoid creating large class hierarchies.
questions.correctAnswer: Use inheritance sparingly and only when it would be more efficient to use than composition but avoid creating large class hierarchies.

questions.question: Which of the following is one way to create an interface in Kotlin?
What is the purpose of traits?
options: The creation of superclasses without the need for creating constructors
The defining of common behavior that classes must implement.
questions.correctAnswer: The defining of common behavior that classes must implement.

questions.question: True or false: traits can be extended using other traits?
Which of the following are benefits of implementing traits?
options: Greater modularity as a superclass can be broken up into multiple traits that can be implemented on an as-needs basis.
The creation of superclasses without the need for a constructor
questions.correctAnswer: Greater modularity as a superclass can be broken up into multiple traits that can be implemented on an as-needs basis.

questions.question: True of False: traits lack the diamond problem that inheritance has?
True or False: objects can use traits?
What is the syntax used in Kotlin for implementing traits?
Which of the following are benefits of implementing traits?
options: Greater modularity: a superclass can be broken up into multiple traits that can be implemented individually.
It is just another way to implement a superclass without the need for a constructor.
questions.correctAnswer: Greater modularity: a superclass can be broken up into multiple traits that can be implemented individually.
